Match_Rule_ConfigurationObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Match_Rule_ConfigurationObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Match_Rule_ConfigurationObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: A reference to an existing match rule to update. If this field is omitted, a new match rule will be created.

Match_Rule_Detail_Data.description: The Reference ID for the match rule.
Specifies whether the match rule for finding duplicate records is enabled.

validation.validation: You can't modify this field because a duplicate management job is in progress.

Unique_IdentifierObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Unique_IdentifierObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Unique_IdentifierObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Match_Rule_Detail_Data.description: The criteria used by the match rule to identify duplicate records.

validation.validation: There’s more than 1 rule with the same Match Criteria. Select unique Match Criteria for each rule.
You can't edit this field because a duplicate management job is in progress, or the rule is associated with a match record.
There’s more than 1 rule with the same Match Criteria. Select unique Match Criteria for each rule.

Select at least 1 of these fields for the Match Criteria:
Email
National ID
Date of Birth
Phone
Previous Worker ID
Select at least 1 other field for the Match Criteria.
A match rule can't have all and partial components for the same match criteria. Example: a match rule for Name can't have both Name and Name (partial).

Match_Rule_Detail_Data.description: Specifies whether the match rule will automatically merge records if a match is found.

validation.validation: To enable Automatic Merge, enable the match rule and use Exact for the Match Type.
You can't modify this field because a duplicate management job is in progress.

Match_Rule_Detail_Data.description: The name of the match rule.

validation.validation: You can't edit this field because a duplicate management job is in progress, or the rule is associated with a match record.

description: Details related to a match rule instance.
